title: hassan_nasrallah
body:

title: ultima_thule_(ff14)
body:
An image which predominately emphasizes the [[scenery]] of "Ultima Thule":[https://finalfantasy.fandom.com/wiki/Ultima_Thule]. A location in [[Final Fantasy XIV]]'s Endwalker expansion, Ultima Thule is the haven of [[the Endsinger]].

Set at the edge of the universe, Ultima Thule is a combination of "Ultima," to mean "the last" or "final" and "Thule" which was an island north of Britain and the most northern location known to the ancient Greeks and Romans.

title: chocobo
body:
Trademark steed of the [[Final Fantasy]] JRPG series by [[Square Enix]] (formerly Squaresoft).

Large, flightless birds resembling some cross between a [[chicken]] and an [[ostrich]] or other [[ratite]]. Often used as mounts (in the abscence of [[horse]]s). Primarily yellow, though other colors (and sizes) are known. They make "kweh" and "wark" noises. Baby chocobos are "[[chicobo]]s" ("ko-chocobos" in Japan).

A chibi version heads up the [[Final Fantasy Fables]]/[[Chocobo (series)|]] series.

h4. See also

* [[Chocobo costume]]

title: darkness_heels
body:
[[Ultra Series]] multimedia project that began in 2018, centered around the titular team of Ultra Villains, consisting of [[Ultraman Belial]], [[Evil Tiga]], [[Dark Zagi]], [[Jugglus Juggler]], and [[Camearra]]. Initially just a pairing of popular Ultra villains planned to appear at stage shows and in merch, the project was given its own unique story, centered around the five villains being resurrected on the Planet Terrio, stuck in [[humanization|unique human forms]], and working to figure out the mystery behind their resurrection and the man who committed it, Hughes.

Alongside the main five, [[Ultraman Tregear]] and [[Trigger Dark]] are also associated with the team, as well as Belial's servant [[Fukuide Kei]].

The story of DARKNESS HEELS has been conveyed through the [i]DARKNESS HEELS ～THE LIVE～[/i] stage shows, and the [i]DARKNESS HEELS ―Lili―[/i] manga by [[Tsunashima Shirou]], with an "anime project":[https://www.crunchyroll.com/news/latest/2023/11/25/ultraman-darkness-heels-anime-announced] announced in 2023.

h4. See also

* [[Lili (darkness heels)|]]: protagonist of [i]DARKNESS HEELS ―Lili―[/i], and honorary member of the team
* [[Ultra Kaijuu Gijinka Keikaku]]: previous Ultra anthropomorphisation project, centered around kaiju

title: ceobe_(arknights)
body:
[i]Ceobe is always ready to go after the bad guys.[/i]

A playable Caster Operator in [[Arknights]].

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Bolívar[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]March 3[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Perro[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]153 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]3 years[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

A wanderer defeated and taken in by Rhodes Island during a mission in the Leithania region. Wields and collects a variety of weapons, most notably axes, blades, spears and a magic staff. Also likes eating, especially honey cakes.

Her motif is based on the [[Cerberus]].

Her [[voice actor]] is [[Seto Asami|Asami Seto]].

* !post #3798814: Elite II
* !post #4067460: [[Ceobe (Summer Flowers) (Arknights)|Summer Flowers]]

title: drop_shadow
body:
A shadow-like visual effect consisting of a character-shaped area of color offset from the character. The shape of a drop shadow is exactly the shape of the character; if it's angled or distorted, use [[shadow]] instead.

It's basically when it looks like there's a light source just above the character's head, projecting a shadow on an invisible wall just behind the character.

h4. See also

* [[outline]]
* [[shadow]]
* [[Tag group:Image composition]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Drop shadow":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Drop_shadow]

title: jugglus_juggler
body:
[b]Jugglus Juggler[/b]  also called Juggrus-Juggler in some sources, is the former villain of [[Ultraman Orb (series)|]], the main antagonist/deuteragonist of the Ultraman Orb Chronicle, and Gai Kurenai/[[Ultraman Orb]]'s partner turned archenemy turned rival. When in times of peace, he appears as a man in a dark suit, while his true form is a Majin dressed in copper armor.

He appears in [[Ultraman Z (series)|]], where he takes both supporting and antagonistic roles depending on his own agenda. In this appearance he takes on the human disguise of [spoiler][[Hebikura Shouta]][/spoiler].

title: lug_wrench
body:
[b]Lug wrenches[/b] are a type of [[wrench]] that that have specifically-shaped holes (its "sockets") on their ends to physically fit a [[motor vehicle|vehicle]] wheel [[nut (hardware)|]]s (the wheel "lugs"), the fasteners used to hold the smaller parts of the wheel together in place, and are used to either loosen or tighten them.

A lug wrench can come as either L-shaped metal rod, or X-shaped piece, and may be considered as non-ratcheting [[socket wrench]], because they used special shaped holes can be [[socket (tool)|swappable]] with other pieces or not. A lug wrench may be confused with an tire lever by referring them as "tire iron''  a tool that used to separate the tire or hubcaps of the wheel that may be covering a wheel's lug nuts.

h4. See also

* [[Impact wrench]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Lug wrench":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lug_wrench

title: azem_(ff14)
body:
Character in [i][[Final Fantasy XIV]][/i]. The fourteenth seat of the Convocation. Otherwise known as the Traveler, tasked with exploring the larger world of Etheirys and becoming intimate with its myriad peoples and cultures.

[spoiler]They are the past incarnation of the [[warrior_of_light_(ff14)|player's character]], before the world and all its residents were sundered into fourteen parallel reflections. Through their adventures, the player meets a fellow fragment of Azem, named [[Ardbert Hylfyst]].[/spoiler]

title: death_note_(object)
body:
The titular item of [i][[Death Note]][/i]. It is a supernatural [[notebook]] used by [[shinigami]] to kill people by name, provided the writer has seen the victim's face. A specific means of death can be included, otherwise the victim simply dies of a heart attack.

[[Yagami Light]]'s Death Note is notable for its English print.

title: venat_(ff14)
body:
Character in [i][[Final Fantasy XIV]][/i]. Briefly appears in [i]Shadowbringers[/i] and plays a much bigger role in [i]Endwalker[/i].

A tall woman with [[blue eyes|blue]] (sometimes [[glowing eyes|glowing]]) [[blue eyes|eyes]] and [[long hair|long]], [[wavy hair|wavy]], [[white hair|white]] or [[grey hair]] usually worn in a [[half up braid]]. Her attire (known in-game as the [[Sophist's Robe (ff14)|Sophist's Robe]]) consists of [[white robe|white robes]] with a [[white capelet|matching]] [[hooded capelet]] and [[mask around neck|mask around the neck]]. 

She is often seen in the company of her familiar [[Argos (ff14)|Argos]], and tends to be associated with [[crystal|crystals]] and bright [[flower|flowers]]. [spoilers]Takes on [[dual persona|another]], deific form as the heart of [[Hydaelyn]].[/spoilers]

h4. Official art

* !post #5622030

title: andy_bogard
body:
A main character of [[SNK]]'s [[Fatal Fury]] and [[The King of Fighters]] series, and [[brothers|younger brother]] to [[Terry Bogard]]. He is one of the co-protagonists of the greater Fatal Fury series alongside Terry and his best friend [[Joe Higashi]].

Andy is commonly seen wearing some version of a ninja oufit; he typically wears a white shinobi shozoko with red [[gloves]] and [[belt]]. His outfit mostly sports a [[fire]] design. He has [[blue eyes]], and [[long hair|long]], [[blonde hair]] that is occasionally tied in a [[ponytail]] but is normally [[hair down|worn down]].

Andy is a [[ninja]], trained from a young age in Koppo, Hakkyokuseiken, and Shiranui-ryuu Ninjutsu alongside heir to the style [[Shiranui Mai|Mai Shiranui]], in order to work alongside his brother Terry to avenge the death of their father Jeff Bogard at the hands of South Town's crime lord [[Geese Howard]]. Compared to laid-back Terry and jokester Joe, Andy is the serious straight man of the trio, honing his skill to a razor's edge with a killer instinct that lets him defeat foes that even give Terry and Joe a hard time. His singular blind spot is his brother Terry, whom he treats as a rival; he gets too excited fighting him and tends to lose against him.

Mai is his lover and hopes that he will marry her. Though, Mai tends to move the relationship a bit too quickly for Andy's liking. As of [[Garou: Mark of the Wolves]], he and Mai are training a young Shiranui-ryuu disciple, [[Hokutomaru]].

title: protoculture
body:
Ancient humanoid [[alien]] race frequently mentioned in the [[MACROSS]] [[mecha]] anime series. 

It was first referenced in [[choujikuu_yousai_macross|The Super Dimension Fortress Macross]] TV series from 1982.

The [b]Protoculture[/b] created a Stellar Republic that controlled much of the [[Milky Way]] [[Galaxy]] 500,000 years ago. They are responsible for the creation of the Zentradi, the Meltrandi, the Protodeviln, the Zolan and the Human race. 

This advanced civilization also came into contact with the Vajra race and obtained technology from it.

The symbol of the Protoculture is usually depicted in the Macross series as a red or yellow spiral, perhaps to symbolize the shape of the galaxy they once ruled.

title: phantom_(arknights)
body:
[i]Phantom, Rhodes Island Operator, melts into the night like a shadow.[/i]

A playable Specialist Operator in [[Arknights]].

Real Name: Lucian

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Victoria[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]

      [td]185 cm[/td][/tr]

      [td]9 years[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

A lone Victorian assassin with a terrifying voice-based Originium Arts, formerly a member of a destroyed theater troupe. He has now joined Rhodes Island as a Specialist Operator.

He is accompanied by a mysterious [[two_tails|two-tailed]] [[black cat]], [[christine_(arknights)|Ms. Christine.]]

He was debuted in [i]Illusions of the Past[/i] banner in the side story event [i]Darknights' Memoir[/i], although he makes no story appearance in said event. He later received a major role in the Integrated Strategies event [i]Phantom and Crimson Solitaire.[/i]

His [[voice actor]] is [[Ishida Akira (voice Actor)|]]

title: mitsuru_(uramitsuru1206)
body:
Japanese artist who predominantly draws [[Hololive]] fan art.

Their original Twitter account "@Mitsuru1206" was hijacked by a hacker and renamed to "@MangaXOO":https://twitter.com/MangaXOO. The artist initially "requested":[https://twitter.com/UraMitsuru1206/status/1649444802113716224] that it be reported as such by as many people as possible.

The "@mitsuru1206":https://twitter.com/mitsuru1206 (all lowercase) username was later claimed by a third party after the hacker had vacated it. The artist has since contacted this third party and expressed that they no longer have interest in reclaiming the old username. For all intents and purposes, the "@mitsuru1206" account should be considered unrelated to the original artist.

The artist now uses a new account, "@UraMitsuru1206":https://twitter.com/UraMitsuru1206, for their current activities.

title: jaina_solo
body:
A fictional female character from the [[Star Wars]] franchise.

[b]Jaina Solo[/b], daughter of [[Han Solo]] and [[Princess Leia]], is a powerful [[Jedi]] Knight who is also a very skilled [[rebel pilot (star wars)|New Republic Pilot]].

title: y-wing
body:
A fictional [[spacecraft]] from the [[Star Wars]] science fiction franchise.

The [b]BTL Y-Wing Starfighter[/b], built by [i]Koensayr Manufacturing[/i], was a mainstay of the [[Rebel Alliance (star Wars)|]] Starfighter Corps. It was often used as an assault bomber to attack enemy capital ships directly in conjunction with the later B-wing starfighters. 

Affectionately known as a "wishbone" to [[Rebel pilot (star wars)|]]s and New Republic pilots, the Y-wing starfighter was deployed as a fighter-bomber, designed to fight its way to its objective, deliver its payload of high explosives, and fight its way out again. Its weaponry included two laser cannons, two ion cannons, and two proton torpedo launchers. 

An astromech droid, such as an R2 unit, could be plugged into a socket behind the cockpit to act as a co-pilot and manage the ship's various systems. 

It was designed by "Ralph McQuarrie":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ralph_McQuarrie in the 70s.

title: rebel_alliance_(star_wars)
body:
[b]The Alliance to Restore the Republic[/b], also known as the [b]Rebel Alliance[/b] and the [b]Rebellion[/b], is an interstellar faction from the fictional [[Star Wars]] universe.

The Rebel Alliance was created by members of different planets throughout the Star Wars [[galaxy]] to oppose the tyrannical [[Galactic Empire (star Wars)|]] and for restoring the ideals of the former Old Republic. The Rebel Alliance eventually evolved into the galactic [b]New Republic[/b] (and later the [b]Galactic Alliance[/b] according to the old Expanded Universe, now known as Legends).

During the events of [[star_wars:_the_force_awakens|the new sequel trilogy of Star Wars films]] a selected part of the Rebel Alliance was organized by [[princess leia|Leia Organa]] into [b]The Resistance[/b], a small militia supported by the New Republic that is opposed to the evil and powerful [[First Order]].

h4. See also

* [[princess leia|Princess Leia Organa Solo]]
* [[han_solo|Han Solo]]
* [[Luke Skywalker]]
* [[Jaina Solo]]
* [[Poe Dameron]]
* [[Rebel Pilot (star Wars)|]]
* [[T-65 X-Wing]]
* [[Y-Wing]]
* [[Snowspeeder]]

title: poe_dameron
body:
A character from the new sequel trilogy of [[Star Wars]] films. 

[b]Poe Dameron[/b] is an heroic [[Rebel Alliance (star Wars)|]] (now known as The Resistance) veteran [[Rebel Pilot (star Wars)|]] and ace. 

His [[starfighter]] of choice is the [[T-70 X-Wing]], an advanced version of the [[T-65 X-Wing]] fighter.

Poe Dameron was born in a planet called [[Yavin 4]].

Poe first appeared in the [[Star Wars: The Force Awakens]] film from 2015 and he is played by [[Guatemala]]n/American actor [[Oscar Isaac]].

Coincidentally, the planet Yavin 4 where his character was born appeared in the first Star Wars film from 1977 and its scenes were filmed in the country of Guatemala, Isaac's place of origin.

title: rebel_pilot_(star_wars)
body: [[Starfighter]] [[pilot]]s of the [[Rebel Alliance (star Wars)|]] (called later the New Republic and the Resistance) in the [[Star Wars]] [[Science Fiction]] franchise.

title: snowspeeder
body:
A fictional [[starfighter]] and combat [[aircraft]] from the [[Star Wars]] franchise.

The [i]Incom Corporation[/i] [b]T-47 Airspeeder[/b], known mostly as the [b]Snowspeeder[/b], was a very small, highly maneuverable and fast multirole aerospace unit that became famous during the Galactic Civil War for its use by the [[Rebel Alliance (star Wars)|]] as a reconnaissance and aerial assault military fighter. 

The T-47 is armed with dual laser cannons and a rear light repeater blaster for defense. It is also equipped with a rear harpoon launcher and a tow cable for recovering cargo.
 
The Snowspeeder became famous during the battle of [[Hoth]], when a fleet of speeders confronted a powerful attack force of several [[Galactic Empire (star Wars)|]] [[AT-AT]] [[walker (robot)|]]s. 

In addition to cold environments, T-47s were modified by Alliance forces for use in several different climates. The [b]Swampspeeder[/b] version included flotation gear and water-tight seals. The [b]Sandspeeder[/b] was equipped with advanced filters to keep out sand, engine cooling units, and long-range radar for navigating sandstorms. The [b]Skyspeeder[/b] had a pressurized cockpit and more powerful repulsorlifts for higher altitudes.

It was designed by "Ralph McQuarrie":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ralph_McQuarrie and "Joe Johnston":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joe_Johnston in the early 80s.

title: star_wars:_leia_princess_of_alderaan
body:
A young adult novel in the [[Star Wars]] series written by Claudia Gray. The story follows [[Princess Leia|Leia]] as she turns 16 and prepares to participate in the traditional ceremony to declare her intent to one day take [[Alderaan]]'s throne - while also discovering her parents' growing association with the [[Rebel Alliance (star Wars)|]].

A web manga adaptation of the book titled [b]Star Wars: Leia -Oujo no Shiren-[/b] began serialization in May 2019. The adaptation is illustrated by [[Haruichi (Haruichithm)]] and went on hiatus in December 2019 due to the mangaka's health issues. The web manga will resume publishing in May 2021.

title: jakku_(star_wars)
body:
A fictional [[desert]] [[planet]] that appears in the [[Star Wars]] science fiction series.

[b]Jakku[/b] is an arid planet located in a remote sector of the galaxy that has many [[spacecraft]] wrecks on its surface -like [[star destroyer]] ruins and other craft- so [[han_solo|many]] consider this planet a massive junkyard. This is because during the last great [[space]] [[battle]] of the old Galactic Civil War between the [[Rebel Alliance (star Wars)|]] and the [[galactic empire (star wars)|Empire]], several capital ships in orbit crashed on it.

Jakku first appeared in the [[Star Wars: The Force Awakens]] film from 2015.

title: t-65_x-wing
body:
A fictional [[spacecraft]] from the [[Star Wars]] science fiction franchise.

The [i]Incom Corporation[/i] [b]T-65 X-Wing Starfighter[/b] is a fast and heavy armed and armored [[space]] superiority fighter.

The X-wing was a prominent series of multiple starfighters produced by Incom Corporation with a characteristic "X"-shape of four wings, known as S-foils, extending out from the fuselage. 

These starfighters were found in the service of the [[Rebel Alliance (star Wars)|]], the New Republic, and also the Galactic Alliance. 

They were originally meant for the [[Galactic Empire (star Wars)|]] but when the entire Incom design team defected with the prototypes to the Rebel Alliance, this deal was over.

The Incom T-65 X-wing starfighter was the primary all-purpose starfighter of the Rebel Alliance and its successor governments. Known for its versatility and exceptional combat performance, it was a favorite with Rebel and New Republic pilots. Possessing four laser cannons, deflector shields, a hyperdrive, an R2 astromech for repairs and navigation, and a complement of proton torpedoes, the X-wing allowed the Rebellion to launch raids in Imperial space with improved odds of a successful mission. 

In [[real life]] it was designed by "Ralph McQuarrie":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ralph_McQuarrie in the 70s.

h4. See also

* [[T-70 X-wing]]

title: chirrut_imwe
body:
A character from the [[Star Wars]] science fiction series.

He appears in the [[Rogue One: A Star Wars Story]] Anthology film from 2016.

[b]Chirrut Imwe[/b] is a blind spiritual warrior expert in [[martial_arts|hand-to-hand combat]] helping the [[Rebel Alliance (star Wars)|]] in its battle against the [[Galactic Empire (star Wars)|]].

title: star_wars:_the_rise_of_skywalker
body:
An epic [[science fiction]] and [[fantasy]] film from 2019. It is part of the [[Star Wars]] franchise now owned by [[Disney]].

[i][b]Star Wars: The Rise of Skywalker[/b][/i] (also known as [i][b]Episode IX[/b][/i]) is the third of a new "sequel trilogy" of films with a plot set cronologically 30 years after the events of the "original trilogy" of Star Wars movies from the late 70s and early 80s. 

It is a direct sequel to the [[Star Wars: The Last Jedi]] film from 2017.

The new film premiered in December 2019.

title: star_wars:_the_last_jedi
body:
An epic [[science fiction]] and [[fantasy]] film from 2017. It is part of the [[Star Wars]] franchise now owned by [[Disney]].

[i][b]Star Wars: The Last Jedi[/b][/i] (also known as [i][b]Episode VIII[/b][/i]) is the second of a new "sequel trilogy" of films with a plot set cronologically 30 years after the events of the "original trilogy" of Star Wars movies from the late 70s and early 80s. This film is very controversial, dividing the audience, considered by many to be the worst Star Wars film, there is a sentiment that [[Luke Skywalker|Luke's]]  actions contradicted his previous heroic portrayal.

It is a direct sequel to the [[Star Wars: The Force Awakens]] film from 2015.

The new film premiered in December 2017.

title: battle_of_hoth
body:
A fictional event from [[Star Wars]]. It is featured in the second film of the original trilogy from the 80s, [[Star Wars: The Empire Strikes Back]].

The [b]Battle of Hoth[/b] took place in ice planet [[Hoth]] between the elite [[snowtrooper]] legions of the [[Galactic Empire (star Wars)|]] and the fleeing [[Rebel Alliance (star Wars)|]].

[spoilers]It ended in a tactical Imperial victory as Imperial forces were able to conquest the hidden Rebel base. However, it also is considered a strategic Rebel victory as the core of the Rebel Alliance forces were able to evacuate their base to fight another day.[/spoilers]

title: cassian_andor
body:
A character from the [[Star Wars]] science fiction series.

He appears in the [[Rogue One: A Star Wars Story]] Anthology film from 2016 and is played by Mexican actor [[Diego Luna]].

[b]Cassian Jeron Andor[/b] is a young [[Rebel Alliance (star Wars)|]] Intelligence Captain. He has a [[goatee]].
other_names: キャシアン・アンドー

title: millennium_falcon
body:
A fictional [[spacecraft]] from the [[Star Wars]] science fiction series. It first appeared in the  [i]Star Wars Episode IV: A New Hope[/i] film from 1977.

The [b]Millennium Falcon[/b], originally known as the [i]YT-1300 492727ZED[/i], was a modified YT-1300 light space freighter with a storied history stretching back to the decades before the Clone Wars and the rise of the [[Galactic Empire (star Wars)|]]. 

Manufactured by the [i]Corellian Engineering Corporation[/i] in 60 BBY, the light freighter was first owned by Corell Industries Limited and underwent several name changes before being bought by the smugglers Kal and Dova Brigger in 48 BBY, and the ship eventually ended up as the property of the secretive Republic Group under the name Stellar Envoy by 29 BBY. The Envoy was destroyed in a collision with a bulk freighter above Nar Shaddaa, but it was rebuilt and served various owners under different names before Quip Fargil named it after the bat-falcon, and it eventually fell into the hands of [[Lando Calrissian]] after a game of sabacc, but Calrissian himself lost the ship in another game of sabacc -"fair and square"- to the smuggler [[Han Solo]] several years later.

Solo and his Wookiee copilot, [[Chewbacca]], became the ship's most famous and permanent owners, flying the Falcon during their smuggling careers and their subsequent work with the [[Rebel Alliance (star Wars)|]].
The falcon has a cameo in [[Star Wars: Revenge of the Sith|Revenge of the Sith]].

The Falcon reappears in [[star_wars:_the_force_awakens|the new sequel trilogy of Star Wars films]] set 30 years later.

The original model for the Millennium Falcon was created by "Ralph McQuarrie":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ralph_McQuarrie . However, it was changed at the last minute because it too closely resembled the [[Eagle Transporter]] ships used in the [[Space: 1999]] television series from the 70s. The replacement is said to be based on a half-eaten hamburger next to an olive on a toothpick held by George Lucas, which led to staff at ILM referring to the Falcon as "the Porkburger".
other_names: ミレニアム・ファルコン
ミレニアムファルコン

title: baze
body:
A character from the [[Star Wars]] science fiction series.

He appears in the [[Rogue One: A Star Wars Story]] Anthology film from 2016.

[b]Baze Malbus[/b] is a freelance assassin working for the [[Rebel Alliance (star Wars)|]]. He wears red and tan combat armor and uses heavy weaponry.

title: rogue_one:_a_star_wars_story
body:
[b][i]Rogue One: A Star Wars Story[/i][/b], or simply [b][i]Rogue One[/i][/b], is an American epic [[science fiction]] space opera film directed by Gareth Edwards and written by Gary Whitta and Chris Weitz, from an idea by visual effects supervisor John Knoll. 

It is the first stand-alone [[Star Wars]] Anthology film, and the ninth theatrical feature film in the series. 

Set in the Star Wars universe shortly before the events of [[Star Wars: A New hope|Episode IV: A New Hope]], the story centers on a group of [[Rebel Alliance (star Wars)|]] spies on a mission to steal the plans for the [[Galactic Empire (star Wars)|]]'s new weapon, the [[Death Star]]. 

It stars [[Felicity Jones]], Diego Luna, Riz Ahmed, Ben Mendelsohn, Donnie Yen, Jiang Wen, Forest Whitaker, Mads Mikkelsen, Alan Tudyk, Jonathan Aris and James Earl Jones.

title: snowtrooper
body:
A fictional type of [[space]] [[soldier]] from [[Star Wars]].

They are a division of [[Galactic Empire (star Wars)|]] [[space marine]]s who are trained in ice planet environment [[battle|combat]].

title: yavin_4
body: Yavin 4, also known as Yavin, was the jungle-covered fourth moon in orbit around the red gas giant Yavin Prime. Prior to and during the Galactic Civil War, it hosted the headquarters of the Alliance to Restore the Republic, a group of resistance fighters that opposed the dominant [[Galactic Empire (star Wars)|]].

title: first_order
body:
A fictional galactic military organization from the new sequel trilogy of [[Star Wars]] films. It first appeared in the [[Star Wars: The Force Awakens]] movie from 2015.

The [b]First Order[/b] is the successor to the old [[Galactic Empire (star Wars)|]] from the original trilogy. Is a military junta or clandestine army made from several new members and the remnants of the original Empire who seek to once again dominate and control the galaxy.

h4. See also

title: tie_interceptor
body:
A fictional attack [[spacecraft]] from the [[Star Wars]] universe.

The [i]Sienar Fleet Systems[/i] [b]TIE Interceptor[/b] was an advanced variant of the standard Imperial TIE fighter seen in massive numbers throughout most of the Galactic Civil War and onward. 

This one-man small attack craft was highly maneuverable and even faster than the TIE, but it also lacked any hyperdrive and did not have deflector shields, so was usually deployed in vast numbers. It was armed with four laser cannons. TIE Interceptors were usually assigned to officers or aces in the [[Galactic Empire (star Wars)|]] fleet's most important squadrons.

h4. See also

* [[Soontir Fel]]
* [[TIE Fighter]]

title: tie_advanced_x1
body:
A fictional attack [[spacecraft]] from the [[Star Wars]] universe.

The [i]Sienar Fleet Systems[/i] [b]TIE Advanced X1[/b] is an advanced experimental [[starfighter]] prototype of the original dual [[energy cannon]] [[TIE Fighter]], now also equipped with [[missile launcher]]s, a fully functional hyperdrive and powerful energy shields. It was designed in-universe by the Empire's weapon designer [[death_star|Raith Sienar]], famous for creating many other Imperial weaponry.

The TIE Advanced is the fighter of choice of [[Darth Vader]], the [[Galactic Empire (star Wars)|]]'s top starfighter ace [[pilot]].

In [[real life]] it was designed by "Ralph McQuarrie":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ralph_McQuarrie in the 70s.

h4. See also

* [[TIE Interceptor]]

title: coruscant
body:
A fictional [[planet]] from [[Star Wars]].

[b]Coruscant[/b] was originally the capital of the Galactic Republic and later became capital of the [[Galactic Empire (star Wars)|]]. It is an Earth-type planet with a very stable geology that is covered with a massive [[cityscape]], millions of [[building]]s and thousands of urban centers across its entire planetary surface.

title: death_star
body:
[i]Space station. Not a moon...[/i]

The [b]Death Star[/b] was the most powerful super weapon in the [[Galactic Empire (star Wars)|]]'s arsenal. It was a weapon of mass destruction and a doomsday device capable of destroying entire planets with a single powerful blast of its massive superlaser. It was meant to strike fear in the hearts of those who would dare to oppose the Empire.

The Death Star was an Imperial space station shaped like an artificial small moon. It was operated by thousands of Imperial personnel and had a massive complement of Imperial troops, vehicles and [[spacecraft]] on its many docking bays and hangars scattered across its main superstructure. 

Its final design and construction were supervised by Imperial weapons designer, [[tie_fighter|Raith Sienar]], from original blueprints captured from Confederacy [[alien]] scientists and weapon designers who crafted them during the Clone Wars.

In [[real life]] the Death Star was designed by "Ralph McQuarrie":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ralph_McQuarrie in the 70s for the first [[Star Wars]] film.

title: tie_pilot
body:
[[Spacecraft]] and [[starfighter]] pilots of the [[Galactic Empire (star Wars)|]] in the [[Star Wars]] series. 

They have an armored black [[pilot suit]] and gear similar to that of the [[AT-AT Pilot]], but better designed for outer [[space]] [[spacecraft]] and [[starfighter]] combat.

title: emperor's_royal_guard
body:
A fictional organization from the [[Star Wars]] [[science_fiction|sci-fi]] series.

The [b]Emperor's Royal Guard[/b] is the group of elite armed and armored guards of Emperor [[Palpatine]], supreme ruler of the [[Galactic Empire (star Wars)|]].

They are experts in secret [[martial_arts|hand-to-hand]] combat and wear unique red body armor and cloaks, and are also armed with exotic melee and energy weaponry.

title: admiral_motti
body:
A fictional character from [[Star Wars]].

[b]Conan Antonio Motti[/b] was a human male admiral in the Imperial Navy who served as a naval chief for much of the reign of the [[Galactic Empire (star Wars)|]].

title: at-te_walker
body:
A fictional walker [[mecha]] from the [[Star Wars]] [[Science fiction]] series.

The [i]Kuat Drive Yards[/i] [b]All Terrain Tactical Enforcer[/b], also known as the [b]AT-TE Walker[/b], was an assault mecha of the Galactic Republic's arsenal used by its Clone Army. 

It is a six legged armored walking machine armed with several swivel laser guns and one powerful energy cannon at the top of its main fuselage. The [[Clone Trooper]] operator of this cannon remains relatively exposed to enemy fire during combat.

The AT-TE [[walker (robot)|]] was used extensively by the Republic forces during the Clone Wars. It was the precursor of the far bigger and much more destructive [[AT-AT]] walker used by the [[Galactic Empire (star Wars)|]] years later.

title: at-at_pilot
body:
[[Mecha]] and [[walker (robot)|]] pilots of the [[Galactic Empire (star Wars)|]] in the [[Star Wars]] series. 

They have an armored grey and white [[pilot suit]] and gear similar to that of the [[TIE Pilot]], but better designed for ground vehicle combat.

h4. See also

* [[AT-AT]]

title: deathtrooper
body:
A fictional soldier type from the [[Star Wars]] science fiction series.

It appears in the [[Rogue One: A Star Wars Story]] Anthology film from 2016.

The [b]Deathtrooper[/b] is a type of specialized and elite [[Galactic Empire (star Wars)|]] [[Stormtrooper]] clad in black armor and a modified helmet.

title: saw_gerrera
body:
A character from the [[Star Wars]] science fiction series.

He first appears in the [[Star Wars: The Clone Wars]] cartoon series, and later returns in the [[Rogue One: A Star Wars Story]] Anthology film from 2016, where he is portrayed by Forest Whitaker. Whitaker would later reprise his role as the character by performing as his [[voice actor|voice actor]] in both the third season of [[Star Wars: Rebels]] and the [[Star Wars Jedi: Fallen Order]] video game.

[b]Saw Gerrera[/b] is the founder and current leader of the [[partisan_(star_wars)|Partisans]], a rebel group opposed to the [[Galactic Empire (star Wars)|]].

title: 501st_legion
body:
[tn]Not to be confused with the [[501st Joint Fighter Wing]] from [[Strike Witches]], or the [[real life]] fan-based [[cosplay]] organization with the same name from which this fictional legion is derived.[/tn] 
An elite ground infantry unit of the [[clone trooper|clone army]] of the [[Galactic Republic]] in the [[Star Wars]] universe. When Order 66 was initiated and the Galactic Republic fell, the 501st legion remained, joining the [[galactic empire (star wars)|Imperial army]] as a [[stormtrooper]] legion, still under the command of [[darth vader|Anakin Skywalker]]. The distinguishing color of the 501st legion is blue.

h4. Notable Members
* [[Anakin Skywalker]] - [[jedi|Jedi General]]
* [[Ahsoka Tano]] - [[jedi|Jedi Commander]]
* [[captain rex|Captain CT-7567 "Rex"]] - [[clone trooper|Clone Commander]]

h4. External Links
* "Wookiepedia":[https://starwars.fandom.com/wiki/501st_Legion]

title: scout_trooper
body:
Soldiers of the [[Galactic Empire (star Wars)|]] in the [[Star Wars]] series. 

They are a variant of the regular Stormtroopers that specializes in reconnaissance missions.

h4. See also

title: star_wars_jedi:_fallen_order
body:
[i][b]Star Wars Jedi: Fallen Order[/b][/i] is an action-adventure [[video game]] developed by [[Respawn Entertainment]] and published by [[Electronic Arts]]. 

It was released for [[Microsoft Windows]], [[PlayStation 4]], and [[Xbox One]] on November 15, 2019. A [[Google Stadia]] version later released in 2020. 

The game is set in the [[Star Wars]] universe, five years after the fall of the Galactic Republic and rise of the [[Galactic Empire (star Wars)|]] (as depicted in [i]Star Wars: Episode III – Revenge of the Sith[/i]), and follows a young [[Jedi]] Padawan named [[Cal Kestis]] as he is hunted through the galaxy by the Empire, all the while attempting to complete his Jedi training and restore the now wiped out Jedi Order.

The game was announced during E3 2018, with a more detailed reveal during the Star Wars Celebration in April 2019. The game received generally favorable reviews from critics and sold more than eight million copies by the end of January 2020. 

h4. Other characters

* [[BD-1]]
* [[Nightsister Merrin]]
* [[Second Sister (Star Wars)|]]
other_names: ジェダイ:フォールン・オーダー

title: at-at
body:
A fictional [[walker (robot)|]] [[mecha]] from the [[Star Wars]] science fiction and [[fantasy]] series. It first appeared in the [[Star Wars: The Empire Strikes Back]] film from 1980.

The [i]Kuat Drive Yards[/i] [b]All Terrain Armored Transport Walker[/b], also known as the [b]Imperial Walker[/b] or simply as the [b]AT-AT Walker[/b], was a powerful and devastating mecha of the [[Galactic Empire (star Wars)|]]'s arsenal. 

Imperial Walkers were designed to break through enemy lines, obliterate hostile bases and as a troop transport (it could carry up to 40 troops depending on its internal configuration). It was one of the biggest, most heavily armored and armed land vehicles in all the Imperial Army, but was also known for its relatively slow speed.

The AT-AT was 20 mts long, 22.5 mts high and traveled at a maximum speed of 60 km/h. It was piloted by two especialized Imperial Pilots called [[AT-AT pilot]]s.

In [[real life]] it was designed by "Ralph McQuarrie":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ralph_McQuarrie and "Joe Johnston":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joe_Johnston in the late 70s and early 80s.

h4.See also

* [[AT-TE Walker]]
* [[AT-ST]]

title: k-2so
body:
A fictional [[robot]] character from the [[Star Wars]] science fiction series.

It appears in the [[Rogue One: A Star Wars Story]] Anthology film from 2016 and is voiced by American actor "Alan Tudyk":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alan_Tudyk .

[b]K-2SO[/b] is a [[Galactic Empire (star Wars)|]] combat droid.

title: mouse_droid
body:
A fictional [[robot]] from the [[Star Wars]] [[Science fiction]] and [[Fantasy]] series.

The [b]MSE-6-Series Repair Droid[/b], sometimes referred to as the [b]Mouse Droid[/b], was a small, box-shaped, wheeled general purpose MSE-series droid often used for delivery and maintenance purposes. 

MSE-6 units were most notably deployed in [[Star Destroyer]]s and both Death Stars during the time of the Galactic Empire. [i]Rebaxan Columni[/i] was the Chadra-Fan aliens' company responsible for the production of the MSE-6-series repair droid. 

The MSE-series was a popular line of MSE Mouse Droids. These droids were usually programmed with a single function that varied per assignment. Once they were set on the task, they would do nothing else. 

The MSE-Series General-Purpose Droid was originally sold to the Chadra-Fan homeworld. They mimicked the pleeky, a common household pet. They thought that the Galactic market would consider it "cute", and manufactured these droids in the billions. They sold very well at first but eventually  most of them were returned, as they reminded people of disease-carrying vermin. 

In one event, the entire Aar'aa [[alien]] species sent them back. The reason was that the little droids skittering underfoot made them uncomfortably hungry. 

Eventually [i]Rebaxan-Columni[/i] directors became so desperate that they offered every one of the droids to the Imperial Navy, as they were short on droids and needed to catch up with the other Imperial forces. They offered them for a small price and gave all to the [[Galactic Empire (star Wars)|]]; every ship in the fleet had hundreds of them. Their use was only limited by their owner's creativity.

The Mouse Droids were often used to carry messages in vast Imperial ships and battle stations as well as leading troops through mazes of corridors to their assigned posts. They also have two small internal arms and can do a variety of tasks such as sanitation and security. On the [[Death Star]]s they usually led [[stormtrooper]]s through its many hallways and levels. These droids were programmed to melt their processors upon capture, creating a small, localized explosion.

title: orson_krennic
body:
A character from the [[Star Wars]] science fiction series.

He appears in the [[Rogue One: A Star Wars Story]] Anthology film from 2016.

[b]Director Orson Krennic[/b] is a [[Galactic Empire (star Wars)|]] Military Director. He wears a white and black Imperial uniform, black gloves and a long silver cape.
other_names: オーソン・クレニック

title: partisan_(star_wars)
body:
A fictional group from the [[Star Wars]] science fiction series.

It appears in the [[Rogue One: A Star Wars Story]] Anthology film from 2016.

[b]The Partisans[/b] are an extremist rebel group opposed to the [[Galactic Empire (star Wars)|]]. This faction was created and is led by [[Saw Gerrera]].

title: star_destroyer
body:
A fictional massive [[military]] [[spacecraft]] from the [[Star Wars]] science fiction franchise.

The [b]Imperial I-class Star Destroyer[/b], also known as the [b]Imperial I-class Destroyer[/b] or the [b]Imperator-class Star Destroyer[/b], was an iconic class of warships designed by Lira Wessex and built by [i]Kuat Drive Yards[/i]. The Imperial-class Star Destroyers, along with Imperial [[stormtrooper]]s, represented the might of the Imperial Military throughout the [[galaxy]] during the reign of the Galactic Empire. 

The Imperator-class was originally used by the Republic Navy toward the end of the Clone Wars, and served alongside the Tector-class in a few task forces during the conflict. It was at the time one of the largest warship classes in the Republic Navy. It later became a mainstay of the Imperial Navy and was also fielded to a lesser degree by the Empire's successor-states. 

The 1,600 meter long Imperator-class was created early on in the Clone Wars, but only saw widespread deployment after the rise of the [[Galactic Empire (star Wars)|]]. Following the [[Jedi]] Purge, the class was renamed to Imperial, but the original name was used in some official documents. 

The Imperator Star Destroyer is a triangle shaped massive spaceship armed with many turbo lasers, ion cannons and proton torpedo launchers. It has a bridge on top of its main superstructure, as well as a potent sensor array and two massive reflector shield generators above it. This vessel also has a hangar bay at the bottom, equipped with powerful tractor beams and with hundreds of [[TIE Fighter]]s and other dedicated military craft packed inside.

It came to symbolize the tyranny of Imperial rule and was used throughout the galaxy for many decades, even long after the fall of the Empire and the establishment of both the New Republic and later the Galactic Alliance, who appropriated many vessels and used them in their own navies.

title: wehrmacht
body:
The  unified [[germany|German]] [[military|armed forces]] in [[World War II]], including the [i]Heer[/i] ([[Army]]), [i][[Luftwaffe]][/i] (Air Force) and [i][[Kriegsmarine]][/i] (Navy). 

Separate from the [[Waffen-SS]], the paramilitary branch of the [[Nazi]] Party.

The aesthetics of Wehrmacht [[military uniform|uniforms]] influenced various fictional military factions such as the [[Galactic Empire (star Wars)|]], [[Protect Gear]] armor from [[Kerberos Saga]], [[Zanscare]], as well as [[Zeon]] and [[Neo Zeon]].
* !post #7976714: From left to rightーUniforms with their respective insignia of the Heer, Waffen SS, Kriegsmarine, and Luftwaffe. 

h4.See also
* [[Fallschirmjaeger|Fallschirmjäger]]
* [[Russian Liberation Army]]
* [[Stahlhelm]]
* [[List of Uniforms]]
h1. External links

title: grand_admiral_thrawn
body:
[b]Grand Admiral Thrawn[/b] is a fictional character in [[Star Wars]] created by Timothy Zahn. He originally appeared in the Star Wars Expanded Universe's novels, the Thrawn trilogy, before he was made canon in the new Disney Star Wars' canon.

A Grand Admiral within the [[Galactic Empire (star Wars)|]], Thrawn is a [[Chiss]], a race of red eyed, blue skin aliens, which is unusual in the Empire since the Empire are pro-Human and discriminate against alien races. Yet despite that, Thrawn was not only accepted within the Empire but was able to rise to a high position within the Imperial Navy. A brilliant strategist who is well respected by his men, Thrawn commands the remants of the Galactic Empire, following their defeat with Rebel Alliance.

In both the [[Star Wars: Rebels]] cartoon and the live action series [[Star Wars: Ahsoka]], Thrawn is voiced and portrayed by Lars Mikkelsen.

title: star_wars:_the_empire_strikes_back
body:
The sequel to the oiriginal first [[Star Wars]] film from the 70s.

[b]The Empire Strikes Back[/b] is the darker and more exciting (and dramatic) entry in the series released in 1980. 

The story continues the adventures of [[Luke Skywalker]] and the Rebels as they flee the wrath of the mighty [[Galactic Empire (star Wars)|]]. It culminates in [[i_am_your_father_(meme)|an amazing plot twist revelation]] that left audiences in awe the first time the movie was shown in cinemas.

It is considered one of the best film sequels ever made and is considered also the best Star Wars movie ever.

[[Star Wars: return of The Jedi|Return of the Jedi]] (1983) followed Empire, concluding the original Star Wars trilogy.

h4. See also
* [[Battle of Hoth]]
** [[Snowtrooper]]
** [[AT-AT]]
** [[AT-ST]]
** [[Snowspeeder]]

title: yusuf_dikec_(meme)
body: Meme stemming from [[yusuf dikec|Yusuf Dikeç]]'s pose during the [[2024 Summer Olympics]] in France: aiming and shooting with one hand on the gun and the other in his pocket, wearing only casual clothes, ordinary spectacles, and presumably ear plugs as opposed to the specialized gear many of his opponents donned.

title: yes-no_pillow
body:
Yes-No [[pillow|pillows]] are matching pillows. One pillow is blue, and the other is pink. "Yes" and "No" are each written on the sides of the pillows.

These were presented as a prize to the couple who appeared in the talk show, "新婚さんいらっしゃい! ("Shinkon-san, Irasshai! - Welcome, newlyweds!":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shinkon-san_Irasshai])". The program presenter never told how to use it, though it is probably used for the declaration of sexual intention.

Depending on which side is visible in an image, add the [[yes]] or [[no]] tag. Both tags may apply if there’s more than one pillow.

h4. External links

* "Japanese Wikipedia: Shinkon-san, Irasshai!":https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E6%96%B0%E5%A9%9A%E3%81%95%E3%82%93%E3%81%84%E3%82%89%E3%81%A3%E3%81%97%E3%82%83%E3%81%84!#%E3%82%A4%E3%82%A8%E3%82%B9%EF%BD%A5%E3%83%8E%E3%83%BC%E6%9E%95

title: 1koma
body:
A [[comic]] consisting of a single panel per page. A Western example is Heathcliff, or The Far Side.

Do not tag 1koma on [[splash page|full page spreads]], [[segmented comic]]s, posts with [[border]]s, particularly [[inset border]]s, posts that aren't comics but just contain common comic elements such as [[speech bubble]], [[monochrome]], [[greyscale]], etc. The comic must be [[cow tools (meme)|self]]"-contained":[https://solrad.co/wp-content/uploads/2021/04/heathcliff.jpg] in the one panel.

h4. Examples

* !post #2388931
* !post #2280291
* !post #6069159

h4. See also

* [[2koma]]
* [[3koma]]
* [[4koma]]
* [[5koma]]
* [[6koma]]

title: splash_page
body:
A [[comic]] page that consists of a full-page illustration. It is generally not self-contained and often without panels unlike [[1koma]], and, as a whole comic page, it is not [[segmented comic|internally segmented]]. While splash pages are traditionally meant for emphasis (alongside [[two-page spread]]s), many webcomics and online one-shots consist solely of splash pages.

h4. Examples

* !post #5503916
* !post #5503925

h4. External links

* TVTropes: "Splash Panel":[https://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SplashPanel]
* Wikipedia: "Splash (Glossary of comics terminology)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glossary_of_comics_terminology#Splash]

title: segmented_comic
body:
Some [[comic]]s have their individual panels posted as separate images (bordered or otherwise), segmenting what otherwise would've been one whole comic page. This tag is for those comics, which have become increasingly common since the 2010s on social media, where they appear together as one whole.

Do not tag these with [[1koma]], as the panels are not self-contained, but part of a greater whole, nor with [[splash page]], as splash pages are not segmented.

h4. Examples

* !post #585950: A non-segmented comic;
* !post #533160: The same
* !post #533162: comic, but
* !post #533164: now segmented
* !post #533167: into four.

title: parrot
body:
A [[bird]] in the "Psittaciformes":[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Parrot] order characterized by a short, powerful hooked beak, high intelligence, social nature and talent for mimicry. Most are brightly-colored, but some, like the alpine [[kea (animal)|kea]], have quite dull plumage. 

Parrots have zygodactyl feet in which two toes point backward and two forward.

title: video_thumbnail
body:
[b]Artworks that serve as thumbnails[/b] for videos in external platforms (e.g. [[YouTube]], NicoNico, bilibili), which means the entire post is a thumbnail.
 
This tag should only be used in one of the following cases:
[b]1.[/b] The original artist themselves created a video using their own illustration (e.g. post #6849506 and post #5598651)
[b]2.[/b] Someone directly commissioned an artist to create the picture for their video (so they were granted permission to use it as a thumbnail) (e.g. post #6766229)

There must be proof that the image is a thumbnail of a real video, namely:
A. The video is directly linked in the [i]source field[/i] (e.g. post #6278828)
B. The artist linked the video URL in the [i]commentary field[/i] (e.g. post #6582857)
C. By posting a [i]comment[/i] (e.g. post #6813221)

This tag should not be used for [[parody|parodies]] of actual video thumbnails (which means things like post #6515886 and post #6467103 do not qualify for this tag). It should not be used either for redrawn thumbnails of actual videos (as seen in post #8204965)

For posts that depict the User Interface of video platforms or made-up videos, use [[fake video]] (e.g. post #7159298)

[[Making-of]] videos in Youtube and bilibili always include the respective illustration as a thumbnail. However, these must not get this tag because it would dilute its utility and make it redundant.

title: technical
body:
A technical is an improvised fighting vehicle built from a civilian [[motor vehicle]]. It is typically [[pickup truck|a light (pickup) truck]] with a tripod-mounted heavy machine gun on the back. However, they can be built on other types of civilian vehicles (e.g. an SUV, or a medium flatbed truck etc.) and there are many other types of weapons that could be [[manually-operated mounted gun|mounted]] on-board. Technicals are mostly associated with irregular and paramilitary forces.  The etymology of the term is uncertain, but it is believed to have originated in Somalia in the 1980s or '90s.

If identifiable, try to tag the weapon and vehicle too.

Weapons commonly mounted on technicals include:
* [[heavy machine gun|Heavy machine guns]], such as the [[dshk|DShK]] and [[browning m2|Browning M2]]
* [[anti-aircraft|Anti-aircraft weapons]], such as the [i]ZPU[/i]
* Large [[rocket launcher|recoilless rifles]] and [[rocket_launcher|rocket launchers]]

Civilian vehicles commonly used as technicals:
* [[Toyota Hilux]]
* [[Toyota Land Cruiser]]
* Mitsubishi Triton

h4.See also

* "Wikipedia article on technicals":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Technical_(vehicle)]

title: clara_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
A playable character in [[Honkai: Star Rail]]. 

She is a shy young girl orphaned at an early age, accompanied by an ancient mech named [[Svarog (honkai: star rail)|]]. Her greatest wish is "to have a family". Voiced by [[Hidaka Rina]] in Japanese. 

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[white hair]] with [[hair intakes]], and [[red eyes]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[red coat]]/[[red jacket|jacket]], [[brown sweater]], [[white dress]] with a [[detached collar]], and is [[barefoot]]. 

h4. Costumes
* !post #7689995: Splash art (with Svarog)
* !post #7025487: [[clara_(galactic_grand_prix)_(honkai:_star_rail)|Galactic Grand Prix]]

h4. Profile
[expand]
A shy young girl with no home, Clara had no choice but to join the prospectors to survive. She inadvertently reactivated a dormant relic from a past civilization — the robot [[Svarog (honkai: star rail)|]].

"To have a family." This is Clara's response when asked what she wishes for most.

Before long, the usually self-servicing prospectors were united as one under the leadership of Svarog. Around the same time, a mysterious prospector was spotted in the Fragmentum, a red-hooded specter adept at retrieving rare relics from the most dangerous places.

Terrified prospectors call this ghostly figure... the Bloody Rabbit.
[/expand]

h4. See also
* [[Clara (Pure Sugar Child) (Honkai: Star Rail)|Ruan Mei's creations: Pure Sugar Child]]
other_names: クラーラ(スターレイル)

body:

title: franziska_von_karma
body:
An [[Ace Attorney]] character. The daughter of [[Manfred von Karma]] and a prosecuting attorney. Beats other court attendees, especially male ones, with a [[whip]] at the slightest little provocation. Frequently uses the word "fool".

[b]Japanese Name:[/b] Karuma Mei (狩魔冥 / かるま めい)

She has [[blue eyes]], [[short hair|short]] [[blue hair]] with [[swept bangs]], and a [[mole under eye]].

She wears a pair of [[earrings]], a [[white ascot|white]] [[ascot]]/[[white bowtie|white]] [[bowtie]] with a [[blue gemstone|bl]][[blue brooch|ue]] [[gem]] [[brooch]], a [[white shirt|white]] [[turtleneck]] [[shirt]] with [[long sleeves|long]] [[juliet sleeves]] and [[sleeve cuffs|cuffs]], a pair of [[black gloves|black]] [[gloves]], a [[skirt suit]] consisting of a [[black vest|black]] [[vest]] with [[diamond button|diamond]] [[buttons]], a [[black skirt|black]] [[pencil skirt|pencil]] [[miniskirt|mini]][[skirt]]; a pair of [[grey pantyhose|grey]] [[pantyhose]], and a pair of [[black footwear|black]] [[fold-over boots|fold-over]] [[high heel boots|high heel]] [[ankle boots]].

title: the_death_of_stalin
body: A 2017 British historical comedy movie based on the 2010-2012 French Graphic novel of the same name, detailing the death of Soviet leader [[Joseph Stalin]] in 1953 and the subsequent power struggle among the politburo in the power vacuum. Although the movie condensed many of the events and took certain creative liberties, it did manage to capture the atmosphere of fear and paranoia of the era.

title: off-shoulder_one-piece_swimsuit
body:
A shoulder-less, [[one-piece swimsuit]] designed with a wide low-cut neckline (much like regular [[off shoulder]] garments), leaving the shoulders and upper chest area [[bare_shoulders|bare]]. It is a swimsuit with sleeves that sit on the arms instead of the shoulders.

One of the variations for the [[meltryllis_(swimsuit_lancer)_(fate)|Swimsuit Lancer]] of [[Meltryllis (fate)|]] is an example of this.

For two-piece swimsuits, see [[off-shoulder bikini]].

h4. Examples

* !post #6413821

* [[Off-shoulder dress]]
* [[Off-shoulder sweater]]

title: xiangling_(genshin_impact)
body:
[[Genshin Impact]] character.

The Head Chef at the Wanmin Restaurant and also a waitress there, Xiangling is extremely passionate about cooking and excels at her signature hot and spicy dishes. Though still young, Xiangling is a true master of the culinary arts with all the skills of a kitchen veteran. She enjoys a good reputation among the hearty eaters at Chihu Rock.

Her companion panda is [[Guoba (genshin impact)|]].

Her name is pronounced [b]Shanrin[/b] in the Japanese version of the game.

Japanese CV: [[Ozawa Ari]]

h4. Appearance

* !post #4127764: Splash art
* !post #5297105: [[Xiangling (Huanglong) (Genshin Impact)|Huanglong collaboration]]
* !post #7755444: [[Xiangling (Autumn Pop-up Store) (Genshin Impact)|2023 Autumn Pop-up store]]
* [[Xiangling (Genshin Concert) (Genshin Impact)|2021 Genshin Concert]] (No unbanned posts available)

title: gm_custom
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] mechaverse. It first appeared in [[Gundam 0083]] from 1991.

[b]RGM-79N GM Custom[/b]

An extensive post-[[mobile_suit_gundam|One Year War]] upgrade to the [[gm_(mobile_suit)|GM]] [[mobile suit]], outfitted with much more powerful thrusters and verniers for extra mobility. In spite of all that, it was still nothing special in any way, and [[Kou Uraki]] quips that it is "remarkable for being totally unremarkable", a statement that would plague the GM series through all its life.

h4.Related MS development
* [[GM Quel]]

title: lumiora_lumen
body:
A former [[Virtual YouTuber]] from [[NEXAS (vtuber)|]]' first generation. Character design by [[Haruyuki 14]]. Used to share the same character designer with [[Vera Avantgarde]] before Lumiora's graduation. She also shares the same artist with [[Wendy Wanderful]].

On July 29, 2024, Lumiora announced her graduation through her Twitter account, citing personal reasons.

She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[purple hair]] with [[sidelocks]], a [[white hat|white]] [[beret]] and [[purple eyes]] with [[+ +|pluses on them]]. Her outfit consists of a [[necklace]], a [[white dress|white]] [[frilled dress]], [[see-through sleeves|see-through]] [[detached sleeves]], [[white socks]] and [[white footwear|white]] [[shoes]] with a [[white bow]] on them.

Her alternate look has her hair in a [[bob cut]] and a [[white cape]], and a shorter dress sans her detached sleeves and ribbon.

* !asset #23285397: Profile

title: off-shoulder_coat
body:
A [[coat]] that is [i]naturally designed[/i] with a low and wide-cut neckline, not covering the shoulders or upper chest area, leaving them [[bare shoulders|bare]]. However, this tag is infamous for being frequently misused for [[open_coat|open]] or partially-open coats that are worn hanging off the upper arms, regardless of how they were designed to be worn.

h4.Correct examples
* !post #3920022

h4.Incorrect examples
These are regular coats worn hanging off the arms or with [[shoulder cutout]]s; they do [b]not[/b] count as correct usages of the tag.
* !post #8206288
* !post #3841269
* !post #3981557
* !post #6567510
* !post #6034987
* !post #7764486

If unsure whether or not the clothing in question qualifies as an off-shoulder coat, use the [[off shoulder]] tag instead.

h4.See also

* topic #17674
* [[List of commonly misused tags]]
* [[Off shoulder]]
* [[Off-shoulder dress]]
* [[Off-shoulder shirt]]
* [[Off-shoulder sweater]]
* [[Off-shoulder one-piece swimsuit]]

title: ultra_kaijuu_gijinka_keikaku
body:
A [[personification|personified]] [[ultra series|Ultra]] [[kaiju]] project originally proposed by "Griffon Enterprises":[https://www.griffon.co.jp/], which was officially sanctioned by [[Tsuburaya Productions]] after the success of the 2011 Ultra kaiju variety show Ultra Zone. The project would be split into various sub-projects (or versions) across multiple companies - the Griffon Enterprises mixed-media project designed by Pastel Design's [[POP (electromagneticwave)|]], the Dengeki ([[Kadokawa]]) mixed-media project developed by ASCII Media Works, the "Plex":[http://www.plex-web.com/index.html] figures, the [[Kodansha]] project, the [[Tokyo Otaku Mode]] project, the [i]KAIJU MUSUME 6[/i] restaurant operated by THINKR, and the [[AKB48]] crossover [i][[tanabe miku|Tana]][[miclas]][/i]. The transcorporate multimedia project would be formally announced in 2013 through [[Haitai Nanafa]], and by 2020, each project had officially ended.

Of the six projects' designs, the Dengeki designs would generally be the most popular in fanart, in part thanks to the light novel and anime series that ran from 2015 to 2018, with the Plex designs following behind it, and after it the POP designs (varying from kaiju to kaiju).

title: aguila
body:
Aguila is one of the [[kaiju]] in [[Ultraseven (series)|]], and one of the Capsule Monsters that serve [[Ultraseven]]. It has a [[single horn]] on its forehead and its special move is the 'Dino Dash', in which it rushes forward and thrusts the horn into the enemy.

Aguila also appears in the Kadokawa version of [[Ultra Kaijuu Gijinka Keikaku]], designed by [[Tomioka Jirou]].

h4. Ultra Kaijuu Gijinka Keikaku

She is known as Miyashita Aki (宮下 アキ), a first year high school student, age 16, with blood type O. She's voiced by [[Iida Riho]].

IN GIRLS, her best friends and classmates are [[Windom|Shirogane Reika]] ＆ [[Miclas|Ushimaru Miku]], and among the senior members are [[Zetton]], whom she respects greatly, as well as [[Pigmon|Okada Tomomi]], [[Eleking|Kogami Ran]], [[red king (ultra series)|Utagawa Benio]], [[Gomora|Kuroda Mikazuki]], [[guts seijin|Inami Miko]] and [[KING JOE|Clala Thorn]] (with the last two appearing in Season 2 of the anime).

title: living_clothes
body:
When clothing has a mind of its own and can move or talk separately from the person wearing it.

Note that this tag should only be applied to images where the clothing is visibly alive. Even if you know that a particular character (such as [[Senketsu]] from [[Kill la Kill]]) is a living set of clothes, you should only use the [[living clothes]] tag on posts where the clothing is actually shown to be alive and acting as a living being. Don't rely on meta-knowledge and tag it on posts that appear to have a completely ordinary sets of clothes.


* !post #6253184: A living bow
* !post #1638296: Living shirt, note the expressions.

title: kuon_(utawarerumono)
body:
Kuon is the daughter of [[Hakuowlo]] and [[yuzuha (utawarerumono)|Yuzuha]] as well as the Princess of Tuskur, her biological uncle and surrogate father [[oboro (utawarerumono)|Oboro]] being the Emperor (Owlo) of Tuskur.

First appearing in the epilogue of the original game as a baby, she is the heroine and deuteragonist of [[utawarerumono: itsuwari no kamen|Itsuwari no Kamen]] and [[utawarerumono: futari no hakuoro|Futari no Hakuoro]].

Due to her mother dying in childbirth and her father being missing, she was raised by her uncle and several surrogate mothers (being all of the remaining main female characters of the original).

[spoilers]Due to her father essentially being Witsarnemitea, she gained a portion of it's divine power, both the good (phenomenal strength and resilience) and the bad (she is in constant struggle with [[dark_witsarnemitea_kuon|her evil part]]). From her mother's side, she also gained her "gift" (Having all primary elements in one's body typically represents itself as a wasting disease as in the case of Yuzuha. Due to her divine parentage, Kuon can make use of this gift by suppressing the other elements so one can dominate. This was only explained in Futari no Hakuoro.)[/spoilers]

Voiced by [[Taneda Risa]]
other_names: クオン(うたわれるもの)

title: vela_azul_(racehorse)
body:
[tn]Spanish: "Blue Sail". Compare to his dam's name, which means "White Sail".[/tn]

Japanese racehorse. Sired by [[Eishin Flash (racehorse)|]] and foaled by Vela Blanca. He is a black horse with a sock on his right hind leg and a faint crescent-shaped marking on his forehead.

He is something of a late bloomer, perhaps due to originally being misplaced on dirt. Upon getting on turf starting in early 2022, he started winning more frequently, easily becoming Eishin Flash's best progeny by winning the Hanshin Daishoten and the Japan Cup in 2022.

title: tank_cupola
body:
A tank's cupola is a raised, armored structure on the roof of a [[tank]]/armored vehicle or [[tank turret]] that often carries observation devices and has a [[hatch]]. 

Tanks of WW2 often had large cupolas on their turrets to allow space for periscopes or windows to give a crew member, often the commander, a much better view outside the vehicle. Usually they were also the most logical place for the commander's hatch, as it would allow them to stand partially outside the vehicle for a better view or to operate a top-mounted [[machine gun]]. As technology progressed and allowed for smaller periscopes and later cameras, cupolas became shorter and smaller, to the point that some modern vehicles don't have any at all.

title: kiss_(rock_band)
body: [b]KISS[/b] was a former American rock band formed in 1973 by Paul Stanley (vocals, rhythm guitar), Gene Simmons (vocals, bass guitar), Ace Frehley (lead guitar, vocals) and Peter Criss (drums, vocals). The band are famous for the face paint and stage outfits they wear on stage. After over 40 years of recording and performing, KISS finally retired on 2023 after their End of the Road World Tour.

title: machine_gun
body:
A [[gun|firearm]] designed for sustained automatic fire. Machine guns are distinguished from [[assault rifle]]s and [[battle rifle]]s by size and ammunition capacity. Machine guns are divided into three categories:
* [[Light machine gun]]: Fires intermediate-power [[ammunition|cartridges]] (except earlier and [[World War II]] designs like the [[bren lmg|Bren]]). Light enough to be operated by one personnel. Are either belt-fed or [[magazine (weapon)|magazine]]-fed.
* Medium and general-purpose machine gun: Fire full-power [[rifle cartridge]]s and serve in both infantry and emplaced roles. It typically require a crew to operate, due to their bulk.
* [[Heavy machine gun]]: Fires large-caliber cartridges (at least 12 mm but less than 20 mm), dedicated for anti-materiel role. Because of their weight and large size, HMGs are typically restricted to stationary positions.

h4. See also
* [[autocannon]]
* [[Gatling gun]]
* [[List of weapons]]
* [[minigun]]

title: sewing_pin
body:
Slender tools with a head and a sharp point that are used to hold fabric together temporarily. They are a vital tool for sewists and are used for a variety of tasks, including: 
 
Holding patterns: Pins can be used to hold patterns in place on fabric so they can be cut accurately. 
 
Securing seams: Pins can be used to temporarily hold seams together before stitching. 
 
Basting layers: Pins can be used to baste layers of fabric together when making a quilt. 
 
Fitting fabric: Pins can be used to fit fabric on the body. 
 
Securing trims: Pins can be used to secure decorative trims.

title: tefuda_ga_oome_no_victoria
body:
Tefuda ga Ōme no Victoria (手札が多めのビクトリア, En: Victoria of Many Faces) is a 2022-to-Present romance slice of life light novel series written by Syuu and illustrated by [[fujimi nanna|Fujimi Nanna]].  Initially published as a webnovel series starting in 2021, it has also been adapted to a manga that is illustrated by Ushino Komo.

The series follows a young woman called Chloe, a covert operative working for the Haggle Kingdom.  Upon learning that her boss has betrayed her trust by actively lying to her about the status of her family, she no longer wishes to continue living her life for the Haggle Kingdom.  Faking her death, she escapes to the Ashberry kingdom and takes up the identity of Victoria Sellers, a woman immigrating from the Randal Kingdom.  After arriving in the capital of Ashberry, she ends up meeting an abandoned six-year-old girl named Nonna.  Originally intending to leave Nonna with an orphanage, she instead ends up adopting her and also entangling herself with Jeffrey Asher, commander of the Ashberry Kingdom's second knight order, who became her guarantor to allow the adoption to be approved.

h4. Characters

* [[Victoria Sellers]] (Protagonist, operative name Chloe)
* [[Nonna (tefuda_ga_oome_no_victoria)|]]

Note: Names from fan translations prior to official English release, so subject to some change.
other_names: 手札が多めのビクトリア

title: zeta_gundam_3a_type
body:
A fictional variable geometry manned military giant robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It initially appeared in the 2001 short CGI film [i]Gundam Neo Experience 0087: Green Divers[/i] and later in episode 9 (2003) of the series of short anime films [[Gundam Evolve]].

[b]MSZ-006-3A Zeta Gundam 3A Type[/b] 

Also known as the [b]White Zeta[/b] or the [b]Zeta Gundam III[/b], it is a Newtype use variant of the [[zeta_gundam_(mobile_suit)|MSZ-006 Zeta Gundam]] aerospace combat [[mobile_suit|MS]] armed with very powerful energy weapons and operated by [[aeug|Karaba]].

It is piloted by [[amuro_ray|a legendary figure from The One Year War]].

title: pepper_potts
body:
Virginia "Pepper" Potts is a character appearing in American comic books published by [[Marvel|Marvel Comics]]. Created by writers [[Stan Lee]] and Robert Bernstein, and designed by artist Don Heck, the character first appeared in Tales of Suspense #45 (September 1963).
Pepper Potts is a supporting character and love interest of the superhero [[Tony Stark]] / [[Iron Man]]. The character has also been known as Hera and Rescue at various points in her history.

title: char_aznable
body:
The main antagonist of [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] and the eponymous [[Char's Counterattack]], a supporting character in [[zeta gundam|Mobile Suit Zeta Gundam]] and eternal rival and foe of [[Amuro Ray]]. 

[b]Char Aznable[/b], also known as [b]The Red Comet[/b] by the [[Earth Federation Space Forces]] [spoilers](as he was able to destroy 5 Federation battleships with a simple red colored [[Zaku I]] in quick succession during the "Battle of Loum":https://gundam.fandom.com/wiki/Battle_of_Loum)[/spoilers]), is originally a blonde-haired [[Zeon]] ace pilot of the [[Zaku II S Char Custom|MS-06S Zaku II Commander Type]], [[z'gok_char_custom|Z'Gok]], [[gelgoog_s_char_custom|Gelgoog]], [[Zeong|MSN-02 Zeong]], [[AEUG]] [[Rick Dias]], [[Gundam Mk II]], [[zero_shiki_(gundam)|Zero Shiki]], [[Hyaku Shiki|MSN-00100 Hyaku Shiki]] and the [[Neo Zeon]] [[Sazabi|MSN-04 Sazabi]]/[[nightingale (gundam)|MSN-04II Nightingale]]. He is usually depicted with some sort of eyewear or headwear (usually [[sunglasses]] or his trademark [[helmet]]), concealing his eyes.

[spoilers]His real name is [b][[Casval Rem Deikun]][/b] and he has [[blue eyes]]. He stole the identity of [[char aznable (real)|the real Char Aznable]]  (who is mostly identical to him except his brown eyes) to avoid being killed by [[Kycilia Zabi]] as a part of her plan to purge the Deikun family, and as such he chose to conceal his eyes to hide his real identity. He is the actual brother of [[Sayla Mass]]/[[Artesia Som Deikun]] and the true heir to Zeon.[/spoilers]

Char's name was inspired by the real life Franco-Armenian singer and actor "Charles Aznavour":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_Aznavour. In [[Japan]] Char is as well known and popular as iconic characters [[Darth Vader]] and [[spock|Mr. Spock]] are in the West. 

He is voiced by [[Ikeda Shuuichi]].

h4. See also
* [[Lalah Sune]]
* [spoilers][[Char Aznable (real)]][/spoilers]
* [spoilers][[Quattro Bajeena]][/spoilers]

title: matilda_(tank)
body:
The [b]Infantry Tank Mark II[/b], best known as the [b]Matilda[/b], was a [[united_kingdom|British]] infantry [[tank]] of [[World War II]]. With its heavy armour, the Matilda II was an excellent infantry support tank but with somewhat limited speed and armament. It was the only British tank to serve from the start of the war to its end, although it is particularly associated with the North Africa Campaign. It was replaced in front-line service by the lighter and less costly [[Valentine (tank)|Infantry Tank Mk III Valentine]] beginning in late 1941.

h4. See also

* [[List of Ground Vehicles]]

title: virtual_hero
body:
A Spanish-South Korean animated television series produced by Zeppelin TV and Motion Pictures, S.A. for Movistar+ based on the comic book trilogy of the same name created by [[El Rubius|Rubén "El Rubius" Doblas]].

h4. Synopsis

Rubius is one of the 100 selected playtesters for the ORV, an experimental virtual reality device. Connected directly to his neuronal network, these glasses transport him to a computer game universe known as the Game Worlds. Little does Rubius know, it's all part of an evil plan hatched by Trollmask, the devious Master of the Game Worlds, who is holding the players hostage in this virtual setting so that they all witness his victory over Rubius. Alongside his allies Sakura, Zombirella, Slimmer and G4T0, this unlikely hero will take on the challenges of the Game Worlds to free the players from Trollmask's clutches.

h4. Characters

* [[Rubius]]
* [[Zombirella]]
* [[Sakura_(Virtual_Hero)]]
* [[Sherubius]] (Rubius's genderbend)

title: cleavage
body:
The depression or valley created between a woman's [[breasts]] via partial exposure of the chest.

In anime, video games, and art, the cleavage is a popular method of adding some sexual appeal to the character. It should be noted that the cleavage is sometimes shown on characters as merely a curved line, while other times it has an extra, smaller line on the end, making the shape of a "Y" at the top of the depression.

The opposite is [[breasts apart]].

h4. See also

title: zinnia_(pokemon)
body:

This mysterious Trainer journeyed throughout the Hoenn region to carry out her mission as the Lorekeeper of the Draconid people.

She has [[red eyes]] and [[black hair]]. She wears [[earrings]], a [[cloak]], a [[black shirt]], [[grey shorts|grey]] [[short shorts]] with a [[red belt|red]] [[rope belt]], [[grey thighhighs|grey]] [[over-kneehighs]], a mega [[anklet]], and [[toeless footwear|open-toed]] [[grey footwear|grey]] [[boots]].

title: carpaccio_(girls_und_panzer)
body:
A character from the series [[Girls und Panzer]], and introduced in the OVA.

Gunner/Loader in a [[Semovente 75/18]], and a Vice-commander of the "Anzio":[#dtext-see-also] tankery team.

Her nickname is based off an italian dish "[1]":[#dtext-external-links].

Her full real name is unknown, although "Caesar":[#dtext-see-also] calls her "Hina".

Voiced by [[Hayami Saori]] "[2]":[#dtext-external-links].

[expand=Official Character Bio]

h5. Anzio High School

h6. OVA

Vice-commanding officer of the Anzio High School team.

[tn]Source: "[3]":[#dtext-external-links] (post #1727154)[/tn]

h6. Das Finale

Vice-commanding officer of the Anzio High School team. Tank commander and loader of a M41 Semovente. As childhood friends with Caeser, they call each other "Taka-chan" and "Hina-chan". As a person with common sense she's unlike the rest of the Anzio team. She calls Anchovy by the moniker "Duce".

[tn]Source: "[4]":[#dtext-external-links][/tn]

[/expand]

title: umamusume_tanuki
body:
[[Umamusume]] drawn in a [[chibi]] deformed style with a [[tanuki]]-style [[raccoon tail]].

This trend was started by an art of "Shonbori Rudolf" (Feeling-Down [[Symboli Rudolf (Umamusume)|Rudolf]]) drawn by [[Deon (jetaime)|]] (post #5635540). It eventually turned into something like a microcosm of Umamusume, Horse Racing in general and general Internet memery, courtesy of the various anons at [[Futaba Channel]]. A lot of the content consists of short videos with limited animation, usually with the character flailing their limbs on their back (the Jitabata or "flailing" animation) or, more frequently, imitating [[Kakushin-Teki Metamorphose!|the Komaru dance]].

Much of the content depict the horse girls with exaggerated personalities and traits, or warped personalities (i.e. [[Special Week (umamusume)|]] turning into a deadbeat father with gambling issues, squandering her daughter [[Buena Vista (umamusume)|Buena]] [[Buena Vista (old Design) (umamusume)|Vista]]'s earnings in failed bets; anything involving [[Rice Shower (umamusume)|Zakkoku]]...). They aren't limited to the official characters, unmade or not and those original characters can be surprisingly well fleshed out for what should be glorified shitposts. In time, those original characters eventually outnumbered the official characters by a large margin.

This tag should be used whenever the artstyle is used or reproduced (character is drawn like Shombori Rudolf, character does the Jitabata animation or the Umaru Dance...), whenever it refers to a particular video or when a [i]unique[/i] character design for a original character from those videos is used.

title: crazy_keiba_lady_(jra)
body:
A character appearing on a [[Japan Racing Association]] commercial promoting their merch mail-order website, [i]Turfy Mail Order Club[/i].

The Crazy Keiba Lady has [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair|purple]] hair with [[swept bangs|bangs sweeping]] to the left. She has turquoise [[green eyes]] and wears a [[green sweater|green]] [[striped sweater|striped]] sweater and a [[yellow bag|yellow]] [[backpack]]. She is often seen carrying [[stuffed horse|horse plushies]] and other racehorse-related merchandise, and wears a [[animal hood|horse hood]] to bed.

As her name implies, the Crazy Keiba Lady is an avid fan of racehorse-related merch. Her favorite plush appears to be one of the racehorse [[Orfevre (racehorse)|]]. The Keiba Lady's catchphrase is "As someone who likes racehorses...", the first line she utters in the JRA commercial.

Because of her overenthusiastic passion for all things keiba (racehorses), as well as her blank-looking expression throughout the commercial, the Keiba Lady is known as the "Yabee Onna" or "Crazy Dangerous Woman" among the Japanese racehorse community. Fanart of her often portray her as a crazy overenthusiastic fan of [[Orfevre (racehorse)|]], and this has carried on over to his [[Orfevre (Umamusume)|Umamusume counterpart]] as well, especially in the [[Umamusume Tanuki]] series of fan videos. In fact, a character [[art_shift|art shifted]] to resemble her signifies that they have a similar love or obsession towards another character or subject, whatever it is in context.

Official merch of the Keiba Lady is also sold, and can be found under the "As Someone Who Likes Racehorses" label.

h5. Associated characters

* [[Orfevre (racehorse)]]
* [[Orfevre (Umamusume)]]
* [[Orfevre (old design) (umamusume)|]]

h4. External Links

* "Turfy Mail Order Club commercial":[https://youtu.be/NSr34vHNKYQ] [tn]Youtube link.[/tn]
* "Umamusume Tanuki parody of the above":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=82pwPaNngSs]

title: kin'iro_ryotei_(umamusume)
body:
Anime-only [[Umamusume]] character. Background character with no voice lines.

[[Horse girl]]. Has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair|black]] hair done up in a [[crown braid]] and a [[low ponytail]]. Also has [[green eyes]]. Does not have ear/hair decs, but often depicted with cowlicks or her crown braid being more prominent and weighted towards [b]her right ear[/b].

Not directly based on an actual racehorse (i.e. there is no racehorse called "Kin'iro Ryotei"), but her list of achievements and her name are unambiguously references to [[Stay Gold (racehorse)|]]. In particular, during Stay Gold's stay in Hong Kong, his name was translated into Chinese as  “黄金旅程”. Translating 黄金旅程 into Japanese yields "Kin'iro Ryotei".

Despite being a background character, Kin'iro Ryotei has gained some popularity among fan artists, as her implied namesake is the father of the real-life [[Gold Ship (racehorse)|]] and [[Orfevre (racehorse)|]] (the racehorse). This had led to endless fodder for jokes depicting her together with [[Gold Ship (Umamusume)|]], [[Orfevre (old design) (umamusume)|]], and [[Mejiro McQueen (Umamusume)|]].

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Stay Gold (horse)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stay_Gold_(horse)]
* "Pixiv Dictionary: キンイロリョテイ(ウマ娘)":[https://dic.pixiv.net/a/%E3%82%AD%E3%83%B3%E3%82%A4%E3%83%AD%E3%83%AA%E3%83%A7%E3%83%86%E3%82%A4(%E3%82%A6%E3%83%9E%E5%A8%98)]

title: orfevre_(old_design)_(umamusume)
body:
[tn]French: "Goldsmith"[/tn]

An [[Umamusume]] character who was the Triple Crown winner of 2011. Who is notorious for "playing" with his IRL jockey.

Originally made a brief appearance in the 2016 Umamusume Pretty Derby promotional video. 

Most salient trait of this 2016 appearance is her [[mouth mask|face mask]]. Appears to have a split personality that surfaces when her mask is removed. 

* !asset #23246905

Generally drawn together with [[Nakayama Festa (umamusume)|]], as the latter lacks a "canonical pair" to be drawn with. Sometimes these two are further drawn together with [[Kin'iro Ryotei (umamusume)|]] and [[Gold Ship (umamusume)|]] to form the "Stay Gold Family". She is also often drawn along with [[Curren Chan (umamusume)|]] or [[Sweep Tosho (umamusume)|]] as they had the [[ikezoe ken'ichi|same jockey]].

Name-dropped by Gold Ship in the 3rd episode of Season 3 of the Umamusume anime.

She was later added to the game in 2024 with a "newer design":[/posts/7252970] that is [[orfevre (umamusume)|distinct from her 2016 appearance]].

title: spp-1
body:
The SPP-1 (СПП, Специальный Пистолет Подводный "Special [[Underwater]] Pistol") A [[Soviet]] double-action [b][[handgun]][/b] designed in late [[1960s (style)|1960s]], intended for [[frogman|frogmen]] use. It fires 4.5×40mmR [[ammunition|cartridge]] that has a 115 mm long steel [[dart]]. The [[weapon]] has four smoothbore [[multiple-barrel gun|barrel]] that is hinged to the frame, and a huge rounded trigger guard. [[Reloading]] is similar to any break-action [[gun|firearm]], with a [[clip (weapon)|clip]].
SPP-1M is the improved variant.
